Thank you for your reply.

I'm currently using Cantera160r1 and I could not find the 
directory you mentioned.

The only C++ code that I could find was under the following path:

C:\Documents and Settings\Bhupi\My 
Documents\Cantera\include\cantera

which also has a kernel directory under it.

All the files under these directories are either .cpp or .h files. 
Couldn't find any .lib files or even the Cantera.soln file you've 
mentioned.

There were no cantera\build or cantera\win32 that I could find!

Is there anything that I might have missed to download/install?? I 
used the standard msi installers available on sourceforge.

Regards,

Bhupinder



On Mon May 15 18:35:10 EDT 2006, graham_goldin 
<graham.goldin@...> wrote:

> Bhupinder,
> 
> The library files should be in your
> 
>   cantera\build\lib\i686-pc-win32d
> 
> directory.
> 
> They should get compiled there. What I do is
> double click on 'cantera.sln' in the    cantera\win32\vc7
> 
> dir, then do a Build -> Build Solution.
